transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Hey Chris, I want to talk through the search feature requirements. We've gotten feedback that users want better search, especially for finding old meetings and notes.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: Yeah, I've seen those requests. Right now we're just doing basic text matching. What are you thinking - full-text search with filters, or something more advanced?

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: I think we need both. Basic search should work immediately - like typing 'pricing discussion' and finding all meetings where that was mentioned. But we should also support filters - by date range, participants, tags. And maybe even semantic search eventually.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: Okay, so phase one would be improved full-text search with filters. That's doable. We could use something like Algolia or build our own with Elasticsearch. What's the timeline?

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: I'd like to ship basic improved search before launch if possible. The filters can come in v1.1. For now, let's focus on making the search results more relevant - ranking by recency and relevance, showing snippets.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: That makes sense. I can prototype something this week. Quick question - should search include content from transcripts, or just metadata like titles and tags?

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Definitely include transcript content. That's where the real value is - finding that one meeting where someone mentioned a specific feature or decision. But we should highlight which part matched.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: Got it. I'll build a prototype that indexes transcript content and shows highlighted snippets. I'll have something to show you by Thursday.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Perfect. One more thing - we should make search accessible from the command palette too, not just the UI. Power users will love that.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: Absolutely. Command palette integration is easy. I'll add that to the prototype.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Great. Let's sync again Thursday to review. Thanks Chris!
